storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform shift template creation to achieve reusable scheduling.

functional.title: Verify successful creation of shift template with valid start time, end time, and break periods
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role and has 'Create Shift Template' permission
User is on the Shift Template Management page at /admin/shift-templates
ShiftTemplates database table is accessible and has less than 100 existing templates
System time is synchronized and displaying correct timezone

steps.action: Click the 'Create New Template' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Shift template creation form modal opens with fields for Template Name, Start Time, End Time, and Break Times visible

steps.action: Enter 'Morning Shift' in the Template Name field
steps.expectedResult: Text 'Morning Shift' appears in the Template Name field without validation errors

steps.action: Select '08:00 AM' from the Start Time dropdown picker
steps.expectedResult: Start Time field displays '08:00 AM' and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Select '05:00 PM' from the End Time dropdown picker
steps.expectedResult: End Time field displays '05:00 PM' and duration calculation shows '9 hours' below the field

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button and enter break from '12:00 PM' to '01:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Break period is added to the list showing '12:00 PM - 01:00 PM (1 hour)' and net working hours updates to '8 hours'

steps.action: Click the 'Save Template' button at the bottom of the form
steps.expectedResult: Green success banner appears at top of page with message 'Shift template created successfully' and modal closes automatically

steps.action: Verify the newly created template appears in the templates list
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Morning Shift' is visible in the list with details: 08:00 AM - 05:00 PM, 1 break, 8 hours net time

postconditions: New shift template 'Morning Shift' is saved in ShiftTemplates database table with status 'Active'
Template appears in the templates list and is available for selection in scheduling workflows
User remains on the Shift Template Management page with the list view displayed
API POST request to /api/shift-templates returns 201 status code with template ID in response

functional.title: Verify creation of shift template with multiple break periods within valid shift hours
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with template creation permissions
User is on the Shift Template Management page
No existing template with name 'Extended Shift' exists in the system
Browser supports time picker input fields

steps.action: Click 'Create New Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Template creation form opens with all required fields visible and enabled

steps.action: Enter 'Extended Shift' in Template Name field and set Start Time to '06:00 AM' and End Time to '10:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input, duration shows '16 hours', and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button and add first break from '09:00 AM' to '09:15 AM'
steps.expectedResult: First break appears in break list showing '09:00 AM - 09:15 AM (15 minutes)'

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button again and add second break from '01:00 PM' to '02:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Second break appears in list showing '01:00 PM - 02:00 PM (1 hour)', total breaks shows '2', net hours updates to '14 hours 45 minutes'

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' button again and add third break from '06:00 PM' to '06:30 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Third break appears showing '06:00 PM - 06:30 PM (30 minutes)', net hours updates to '14 hours 15 minutes'

steps.action: Click 'Save Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Shift template created successfully' appears and template is saved

postconditions: Template 'Extended Shift' is created with 3 break periods stored correctly in database
All break times are non-overlapping and fall within shift start and end times
Template is immediately available for use in scheduling operations
System audit log records template creation with timestamp and administrator user ID

negative.title: Verify system prevents template creation when end time is before or equal to start time

steps.action: Click 'Create New Template' button to open the creation form

steps.action: Enter 'Invalid Time Shift' in Template Name field
steps.expectedResult: Template name is accepted without errors

steps.action: Set Start Time to '03:00 PM' and End Time to '09:00 AM' (end time before start time)

steps.expectedResult: 'Save Template' button is disabled or clicking it shows error message 'Please fix validation errors before saving' and form does not submit

steps.action: Change End Time to '03:00 PM' (equal to start time)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error persists showing 'End time must be after start time' or 'Shift duration must be greater than 0 hours'

steps.expectedResult: Network tab shows no POST request is sent and no database record is created

postconditions: No template is created in the database
User remains on the template creation form with validation errors displayed
Form fields retain entered values for correction
Error count in success metrics is not incremented as submission was blocked

steps.expectedResult: Validation error persists showing overlap conflict with first break period

userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
The ability to create shift templates is essential for streamlining the scheduling process. This feature allows administrators to define shifts that can be reused, reducing the time spent on scheduling.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, scheduling is done manually without templates, leading to inconsistencies and increased workload.

DESIRED STATE:
Administrators can create and manage templates, ensuring consistency and efficiency in scheduling.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
‚Ä¢ Create new shift templates with start and end times.
‚Ä¢ Define break times within templates.
‚Ä¢ Edit existing templates as needed.
‚Ä¢ Delete templates that are no longer in use.

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. Administrator navigates to the shift template management page.
2. Administrator clicks on 'Create New Template'.
3. Administrator inputs shift details (start time, end time, breaks).
4. Administrator saves the template.
5. System confirms template creation.
6. Administrator can view the list of created templates.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Data source: ShiftTemplates table in the database.
‚Ä¢ Validation rules: Ensure start time is before end time.
‚Ä¢ API endpoints: POST /api/shift-templates for creation.
‚Ä¢ Security: Only authorized administrators can create templates.
‚Ä¢ Performance: System should handle up to 100 templates without performance degradation.

OUT OF SCOPE:
‚Ä¢ Employee-specific scheduling is not included in this story.

SUCCESS METRICS:
‚Ä¢ 90% of templates created without errors.
acceptanceCriteria: System allows creation of shift templates with valid start and end times.
System validates break times and ensures they do not overlap with shift times.
System displays a confirmation message upon successful template creation.
System lists all created templates for review.
